text: right Commando is a role-playing game published by Simulations Publications, Inc. in 1979. ==Description== Commando is a military system of commando operations from World War II to the present. The game is primarily a board wargame with secondary role-playing rules (24-pages) for character creation, skills, cooperative fire teams, and hero characters. Eric Goldberg designed Commando as a man-to-man tactical combat game featuring character creation and skills. ==Publication history== Commando was designed by Eric Goldberg, and published by Simulations Publications, Inc. in 1979 as a boxed set containing a 48-page book and a 24-page book, 12 maps, a charts folder, and dice. ==Reception== Commando won the H.G. Wells award for Best Roleplaying Rules of 1979. ==References== Category:Military role-playing games Category:Origins Award winners Category:Role-playing games introduced in 1979 Category:Simulations Publications games
